text: the idea that dream jobs exist or jobs
that align perfectly with our goals
purpose and values is still pretty
popular but finding a perfect job isn't
easy and it can even feel demotivating
if we put too much pressure on ourselves
if this sounds at all familiar and
you're stuck in a job that doesn't
really match your long-term goals one of
our authors has a good piece of advice
Howell says accepting your circumstances
isn't a sign of weakness especially
during uncertain times to explain her
point she talks about Abraham maso's
hierarchy of needs which is usually
represented in a pyramid like this first
proposed in 1943 the theory says that
people must fulfill their basic level
needs like food water clothing and
warmth before they can pursue higher
level ones like purpose or happiness
it's incredibly hard for anyone to
pursue their dream career or gain
Financial Freedom when their priorities
are just trying to find a job in a tough
Market or make enough money to pay off
student loans or pay for basic needs
like food and rent in these moments
instead of chasing a dream job it's
totally okay to take a pause and focus
on the basics it may sound
counterintuitive but it's going to be
really hard to pursue those higher level
goals until your basic needs are met
Sometimes the best way to move forward
is to hone in on what you need right now
